# Methodology
Convergence and estimation stability are measured by the number of successful NUTS runs in relation to the total number of runs.

# Model 1
```{r}
model <- c("baseline",
           "two classes",
           "two classes",
           "two classes",
           "three classes",
           "three classes",
           "three classes")

dataset <- c("1","2","3","4","5","6","6")

part <- c("","","","","","one","two")

convergence <- c("5 / 5",
                 "4 / 5",
                 "2 / 5",
                 "4 / 5",
                 "2 / 5",
                 "4 / 5",
                 "5 / 5")

estimation <- c("5 / 5",
                "4 / 5",
                "2 / 5",
                "4 / 5",
                "2 / 5",
                "4 / 5",
                "5 / 5")

df <- data.frame(model,
                 dataset,
                 part,
                 convergence,
                 estimation)

names(df) <- c("Model",
               "Dataset",
               "Part",
               "Convergence stability",
               "Estimation stability")

flextable(df)
```
